title.narrative: UNOAU 2019-2020 Advancing the WPS Agenda within the UN-AU Partnership
UNOAU 2019-2020 Advancing the WPS Agenda within the UN-AU Partnership

description.narrative:
Förenta Nationernas representation vid Afrikanska Unionen (United Nations Office to the African Union, hädanefter UNOAU) har ansökt till Sida om finansiering med 3000000 SEK för att genomföra projektet 'Advancing the Women, Peace and Security Agenda within the UN-AU partnership' med fokus på personalresurser dels för kapacitetsuppbyggnad av UNOAU och dels för jämställdhetsintegrering på UNOAU samt Särskilda sändebudets för Sudan och Sydsudan kontor (Office of the Special Envoy to the Sudan and South Sudan, OSESS).
Insatsen syftar till att institutionalisera medvetenhet om jämställdhet i politiskt beslutsfattande och programmering i FN-AU-insatser och OSESS, genom att tillsätta en jämställdhetsrådgivare som tillhandahåller strategiskt stöd för integration av genus på alla arbetsområden inom UNOAU, AU och OSESS. Detta kommer att uppnås genom
1) Tillhandahållande av rådgivning, stöd och teknisk kapacitet till AU vid bedömning och förstärkning av organisationens metod för jämställdhetsintegrering över konflikthanteringscykeln, och i FN-AU-partnerskapets ramverk för fred och säkerhet
2) Säkerställa effektiv implementering av befintliga insatser och policy för främjande av jämställdhet, kvinnors rättigheter och förhindrandet av sexuellt våld i alla UNOAU och OSESS insatser.
Den totala budgeten för interventionen är 3 000 000 SEK och kommer uteslutande att finansieras av Sida.

The United Nations Office to the African Union(UNOAU) has applied to Sida for funding of SEK 3,000,000 to carry out the ‘'Advancing the Women, Peace and Security Agenda within the UN-AU partnership ’ project focusing on Staff, Capacity building and Outreach in UNOAU and the Office of the Special Envoy for Sudan and South Sudan (OSESSS).
The intervention aims at institutionalizing gender-responsive policy making and programming in UN-AU efforts and OSESS by putting in place a designated gender advisor who provides strategic support for integration of gender in all areas of work within UNOAU, AU and OSESSS; This will be accomplished through 1)Providing advisory support and technical assistance to the AU in assessing and strengthening their approach to gender mainstreaming across the conflict management cycle and in the framework of the UN-AU partnership in peace and security 2)Ensuring effective implementation of existing mandates and policies for the promotion of gender equality, women’s rights and prevention of sexual violence in all UNOAU and OSESSS mandated tasks.
The total budget for the intervention is 3 000 000 SEK and will be covered exclusively by Sida.

participating-org.narrative: UNDPA/United Nations Department of Political Affairs
UNDPA/United Nations Department of Political Affairs

sector.narrative: Women’s rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

tag.narrative: 16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.
5.1 - Avskaffa alla former av diskriminering av alla kvinnor och flickor överallt
5.1 - End all forms of discrimination against all women and girls everywhere.
5.5 - Ensure women’s full and effective participation and equal opportunities for leadership at all levels of decision-making in political, economic and public life.
5.5 - Tillförsäkra kvinnor fullt och faktiskt deltagande och lika möjligheter till ledarskap på alla beslutsnivåer i det politiska, ekonomiska och offentliga livet.
5.c - Adopt and strengthen sound policies and enforceable legislation for the promotion of gender equality and the empowerment of all women and girls at all levels.
5.c - Anta och stärka välgrundad politik och genomförbar lagstiftning för att främja jämställdhet och öka alla kvinnors och flickors egenmakt på alla nivåer

title.narrative: Agreement between Sida and UNOAU Contribution No.12420
Amendment to the Agreement on support to UNOAU

description.narrative: The initiative is a work in progress and thus results are yet to be achieved. However, there are promising strides made by the gender team to give gender equality due prominence in UNOAU and the Office of the Special Envoy for the Horn of Africa (OSE-HOA) and the African Union Commission (AUC). Some of these advances include; - A good foundation has been laid for a stronger partnership with the AUC and IGADdue to the establishment of the temporary gender unit within UNOAU. - Increased staff consciousness in UNOAU and OSE-HOA for gender mainstreamingreflected in the increased demand for the engagement of the gender team in plannedactivities. - Support to the high level mission to the Horn of Africa particularly in Ethiopia tounderline the need for inclusive peace processes, elevating the voices of women and the importance of the protection of women and girls in conflict-affected areas. - Support to the FemWise-Africa at AUC in development of policy document,accreditation and outreach strategies, membership, training and capacity building efforts. - Provided political leadership and support for the UN-EU-AU tripartite negotiations onthe Spotlight Project. - Contributed to the development of 1325 Commemorative Book titled "She stands for Peace- 20 years, 20 Journeys" documenting the individual stories of 17 African women and 3 women's groups. - Provision of technical support to the African Peer Review Mechanism (APRM) in astudy on "Gender, Governance and Peace Building: Strengthening the Nexus" Positive outcomes are also expected from the ongoing efforts including development of a Standardized Gender, Women, Peace and Security training curriculum, and guidelines for mainstreaming gender into peace and security; Development of Gender and WPS country profiles for the 8 countries in the Horn of Africa. - Preparations are currenlty underway to launch series of intiatives in commemoration of the 20th anniversary of UNSCR 1325 where the Foreign Minister and the Embassy are expected to participate in.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
